page.title: 13Interview_Mrs.Goussen
page.content: Mrs.Goussen has lived in Seaford for a long time.She used live in Seaford,but then after a few years living elsewhere,she returned.In her childhood she studied at a school which is now Church Street School. Before the 1st World War there were just over 6000 people in Seaford. There were also 24 Prep Schools. During the World Wars there was a North Camp as far as The Cuckmere and the South Camp as far as Blatchington. The security was very "tight".The police came around and checked the permits of the people,if they had expired they were thrown out of Seaford.Many schools were told to move. After the 2nd World War there were 19 Prep Schools and Seaford Head (Senior) was built.
